holidays.name: Crush a Can Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to the simple yet satisfying act of crushing an empty can. Perfect for venting stress or just enjoying a little hands-on fun!
holidays.origin: Started as an informal environmental awareness stunt encouraging recycling and minimizing trash volume.
holidays.funFact: Despite its silliness, crushing cans saves significant landfill space and is surprisingly therapeutic for many!

holidays.name: Chocolate Milkshake Day
holidays.description: Celebrate one of the most delicious and refreshing beverages by enjoying a rich, creamy chocolate milkshake.
holidays.origin: A classic American treat day that grew from diner culture and the rise of soda fountains in the early 20th century.
holidays.funFact: The first chocolate milkshake is said to have been invented in the early 1900s, long before blenders existed ‚Äî bartenders used shakers!

holidays.name: National Corned Beef Hash Day
holidays.description: A day to savor the hearty breakfast favorite of corned beef, potatoes, and onions all fried up to golden perfection.
holidays.origin: Derived from traditional Irish-American cuisine, celebrated mainly in the US.
holidays.funFact: Corned beef hash was a popular way for Irish immigrants to stretch costly meat with inexpensive potatoes, creating a beloved dish!

holidays.name: World Tourism Day
holidays.description: An international observance promoting the importance of tourism and its social, cultural, political, and economic value worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations World Tourism Organization in 1980.
holidays.funFact: Each year, World Tourism Day highlights a different theme; in recent years it has focused on sustainable and accessible tourism.
